headline: Brunette in Central Park near 72nd Street - m4w
body_text: I was walking through Central Park this afternoon when I took a detour toward the west side. I was at the statue of the Falconer near the 72nd Street entrance when I sat down for a few minutes. I had on jeans and a dark green shirt, and I was carrying a brown leather jacket (it was warm today, even for this time of year.) I dropped my newspaper, the pages blew everywhere, and you ran over to help. You had dark brown, wavy hair, and a black coat. You were wearing a green skirt, or maybe a dress - your coat was buttoned, so I don't know which. In the moment, that's all I saw. I was too concerned, I suppose, with making sure I didn't lose my newspaper to the horses. It's not often that I spring for a copy of the New York Times. The breeze was strong, and the pages were blowing everywhere. But looking back on that brief interaction, there was more. I already had Real Estate and Dining & Wine tucked under my arm, and I didn't notice at the time how you laughed when we both reached for Weather; it was the same way you used to laugh on the playground. You could run faster than all of the boys - even me, and I used to tell everyone (like an idiot) that I could run faster than the wind itself. When you handed me the pages you'd picked up I didn't really pay any attention to your fingernails, but now that I think about it you used to bite them as a child, too. Nervous habit, I guess.I'll know you when I see you, I've always thought. I know I will. I have known it for twenty-seven years and that's how long I have been looking. It was the only thing I knew for certain other than the fact that I hadn't seen you yet, or if I had then I hadn't seen you fully.But really that's only a half-truth. I did see you once when we were younger. Well, technically I saw you almost every day, but there was one day in particular when I saw you: a single glance across a classroom, and you were looking back at me with eyes that were quicker than mine, smarter than mine. I knew you, then, but it was just a glimpse, and I thought I couldn't trust it. I didn't know I could trust it; we were only kids, after all. I looked away, and I've never been sorrier for any mistake I've made thus far in my life.Your eyes today - I don't know how I didn't recognize you in them.When you and I disappeared from each others' lives so many years ago, I didn't think of you at first. I'm sorry to say that most days I didn't think of you at all. Ashamed, if I'm being honest. But after a time - I can't say for sure how long - I started thinking of you most days. And then I started looking.I looked for you around corners. The corners of buildings, I mean, because I was still a boy too afraid that you would see me first. Now I'm older and smarter than I was, and I've learned to look for you around the corners of my mind while I walk north on MacDougal Street. I always throw quarters to the folk singers and shoot the shit with the old timers at the chess tables, and I always stop to talk with Dierdre who lives on Amsterdam Avenue but has sold hats on West 12th Street since 1974. (I wonder if Dierdre is her real name.) I never walk up Sixth Avenue because I prefer the closeness of Fifth and on the periphery of it all I always, I always, I always look for you.The ages have passed while I've walked these streets. I've seen thousands of faces, millions perhaps, but none of them were yours. I'll know you when I see you - I was sure of it. I convinced myself that I wouldn't even mind if you didn't know me right away. But I thought you would. I hoped.The park is for tourists, and families, and lovers, and secrets, and me.I don't always visit the Falconer. It was more of a coincidence that I turned in that direction at all. Most days I'll wait for you at Bethesda Fountain, but when I'm feeling masochistic I'll turn up at Rat Rock. When I can't take it anymore I'll stop looking altogether and walk through The Ramble until I get lost. (I can't get lost; I know those paths.) But it was the Falconer today, because during these autumn afternoons I like how the statue nearly escapes everyone's notice. I sat to his right, my jacket beneath me to dull the cold ground. I opened the newspaper I'd brought with me; since I hadn't seen you yet, I had to fill my time somehow.I'll never admit it, but I'm good at the crosswords.Sometimes I've wondered how often we've passed by each other looking in opposite directions; or stood on opposite ends of the same subway car; or sat at distant tables in the same bar, both of us drinking whatever's on tap; or; or; or. Sometimes I feared you didn't even live here anymore, that I'd wasted all these years for nothing. I looked into each face - I don't know you, I don't know you. I can't stay if you're not here, but I won't leave in case you are.I sat there on the grass, waiting, because that's mostly what I have done these many years - even while doing other things, really I'm always waiting to run into you again. At times I've wondered if there's something wrong with me, to spend half my life looking for someone who might be looking for someone else. Anyway, I must have been distracted by the leaves raining down, so when the wind picked up I lost my grip on the newspaper. The sections came apart mid-fall and landed scattered across the walking path below my overlook. Some people were startled - they really don't notice The Falconer up here, out of the way - and I jumped up to collect the pages before they blew into the street and I lost them to the horses and - oh, you know the rest.I saw you, but I didn't know you. I guess it's my fault; I wasn't paying attention. I guess you weren't either. So maybe we're both to blame. You know, sometimes I wonder if you're even looking. Hell, I'd stay in one place if I knew you were.

headline: No one sees me. - m4w
body_text: My whole life, when I eventually do meet someone I'm told... "you must have no trouble with the ladies" or "you're a good looking guy"... but the truth of it is, and always has been, I go long periods of time between relationships, and I go long periods of time without meeting anyone to even go on a date with. I explain to people, that I must seem intimidating in some way, because I nearly never get the opportunity to capitalize on a friendly glance, or a smile in my direction. If you ask me honestly I'd have to tell you- No one looks my way. Now, I'm 44 years old, single, 5 years since my last relationship, maybe a year since I've been on a date... Granted, I work alternative hours, and I've become very good at filtering out those who are otherwise incompatible to me via the mobile dating apps... which only adds another level of mystery when it comes to the question... Is there anyone out there for me? But overall, if I didn't work alternative hours, which for now I do not, being back on AM's with weekends off- I still suffer from this invisibility I've been victim of all my life. Why am I writing this? No idea. Just venting maybe? Or maybe there are others who feel this way, or have had this experience? Who knows. I'm inspired. So here it is.

There were a few other people on the train, too. You also had some stubble, or a closely trimmed beard; it was very sexy. I gave you a huge smile, and you seemed to acknowledge it. We held eye contact for a long time. I wanted to walk over to you, but since my foot was injured, I wasn't sure how to do it safely while the train was moving.You got off at 96th Street. As the train was pulling away, you blew me a kiss, and I gave you a little salute. If you're reading this, please send me an email with a face picture of yourself, to confirm that it's you. headline: "We Can Do It," Rosie the Riveter - m4w
body_text: Hey, Rosie. Of course that was just your costume on Halloween night. I'm posting here rather than reaching out directly because I don't want things to be awkward. We've got so many mutual friends. We're both single. I thought (especially that first night we met) that there was a very palpable attraction. Most of the males in our clique concur. You like my humor; I enjoy yours. You're attractive. You're thoughtful. You're introspective and considerate. And you've recognized that I'm all of these things, too. So, what makes you "just not into it," when you're into nearly every other half-employed option that passes by? It's confusing.I'm not interested in belaboring a point of preference. I respect it. I just wish I understood. At your party, I heard your friends saying "That's V? He's cute!" in the encouraging way friends say these sort of things. Like there's something about me you're averse to. But aren't we adults? Can't we be childishly, simplisticly, attracted? I'm not interested in politely reaching into the darkness to feel your disinterest. I'm interested in the girl who came across a crowded room to be alone with me last March. I'm interested in being the guy who liked you enough that he didn't fuck you in the basement the night he met you. Instead, I showed you that I was interested. I still smile thinking about how I caught you, falling through the trees in your skis. It was effortless for me. So, Rosie the Riveter... Be as strong as you look? We can do it. Since it's the 5th of November, Remember. Remember. That words can change the world. That behind the mask is not a man, but an idea. And that ideas are bulletproof. All that's left for me to wonder about now is how compatible we might really be. So this is my experiment:I've never mentioned that I troll missed connections before. But I do. Do you? If so, text me already; because (finally) this one was for you.

headline: Yellow raincoat on the B or D - wtf? - w4m
body_text: Are you the dude in the yellow raincoat riding the downtown D or B (I forget) yesterday around 7 pm? If you are - then literally wtf dude?First of all - the staring? Chill your eyeballs bro. I felt those things boring a hole in my cranium before I even noticed you. I get it, ya know? I was looking good yesterday. I snoozed through 8 alarms and stumbled out of bed 45 minutes late. I haphazardly slammed some makeup across my face and threw my dirty hair into a bun. I overdressed because I just moved back from California and I really don't understand the weather here anymore. Later in the day I got caught in a substantial downpour that ignited my frizz filled Jew fro and turned my bangs into much shorter, curlier bangs than I'd ever imagined was possible. Pair all of that with a little late 20's PMS induced acne and the general wear and tear of a long day and damn. I get it. I was looking fly as fuck dude. So I first noticed you when your dumb eyes were laser cutting into my face. I'm like 70% of the way through Into Thin Air so shit's getting good. I'm surprised anything tore me away from that book but it's difficult to ignore someone trying to move things with their brain √† la Matilda or whatever you were doing. I caught your eyes and immediately felt something. It was mostly fear of impending doom because you were FIXATED but also you're not bad looking. Whatever. I'm lonely. I noticed that for some reason you had strapped your backpack across your chest like an overanxious high school freshman OR like Jon Krakauer in the best selling non-fiction book I mentioned was sitting in my lap. Suuuuuup fate?But you ruined it. Listen, I'm 28 years old and spend arguably too much time on my cell phone like most of my generation. This experience means that I am skilled in both taking a stealth picture (flash must be off, noise silenced, body slightly reclined so it doesn't seem like your phone's at a weird angle) and recognizing when someone is taking one of me. I appreciate your ingenuity and technique for sure: you rotated your phone and took multiple pictures in succession. To the untrained eye it maybe looked like you were wiping the screen or learning to juggle in a very inefficient way, but not me babe. I know you took a picture and I am NOT happy about it. Seriously? What part of my sweat soaked, rain drenched, frizz banged, and makeup-less appearance got you going? What did you need to commemorate so badly? It was creepy and weird (and sure I've done it like once) but you made me feel really uncomfortable after a long day. Not cool. But also you have really nice brown eyes and I've been single for a while. Tell me what random organizing thing you were lugging around and maybe we can get together and take pictures together or something.

headline: Her Secret Garden - m4w
body_text: Her garden is ever so lovely... Paths here and there created by hims and thems. Some paths are well worn down. Like they were meant to be forever. But they abounded her. Other trails are barely noticeable. Like they ran through and wrecking her thoughts. I see new pathway that was started but looks like it's a work in process. Unknown if they'll come back to pave the way around her heart. Like a labyrinth the paths flow with dead ends. Randomly meandering through the hedges. In the distance I can hear it beat. Her heart. I whisper soulful thoughts. There... I can hear it skip. Her soul hears the sincerity. Her eyes see into his soul. Has anyone ever looked her in the eyes and seen the world through her peepers? Has anyone been honest enough and worthy of seeing her inner beauty. Most cannot look with pure eyes that are without some hidden agenda or selfish desire. Or they have something to hide. They know she'll see through them...Off the beaten path in the wilderness I wander into her secret garden. Flourishing on her desires. Fantasies, and dreams grow here. Brightly laminated flowers in a kaleidoscope of colors.

headline: to "kat" with the foul, angry rants - w4w

headline: Pink Flamingos and This Mysterious Thing Called 'Love' - w4m
body_text: My dearest Eryn Gardens, Many moons ago, on a late summer night in the West Village, we spoke of alter egos and you had asked me what traits "she" would possess that I didn't already. "Well, she'd be classier, sexier, more cultured. . . She'd probably wear pearls or something". I asked the same question of you, and you told me that "he" would be braver, smoother, and more confident. . . Clearly, that makes two of us or I wouldn't be writing this letter to you, hoping it'll find you well. Instead, I would have grabbed you by the lapels and matched my lips to yours that evening we explored Little Italy for, what felt like, the first time. . . or finally worked up the courage to confess my growing emotions that night we watched one of our favorite shows on your fire escape months ago under that summer moon. The other evening, you had asked me if I'd ever truly been in love. "Yes, just once, I suppose". . . .But, that wasn't an entirely honest response. I asked the same question of you. "No, I don't think I really ever have". You mentioned the difficulty distinguishing between love and familiarity. I told you my philosophy on soulmates. Love's a funny thing, though. . . I've always chalked it up to lust and comfort and familiarity. But, you have to admit, there's something far more mystical about it. . . I recall a very early morning in late June. We were on the J train. . . You know that long haul between Marcy and Essex. . . You and I were traveling home after a long night of filming in Brooklyn and I pointed out the breathtaking view of the city. We took a break from our banter to take in the sights. You thoughtfully took everything in. . . Wandering in between train car windows to catch every possible angle. Anyway, there are a few things I never told you about that day. . . The evening prior, on my way to that very shoot, I rode the same train and admired the same beautiful surroundings. The moment was picturesque. But, I remember thinking "I really wish I could share this with someone. . ." Someone who would genuinely understand the loveliness that was surrounding me at that exact minute. That exact second. I felt so very fortunate to be able to share that moment with you. And, to be honest, watching you find the beauty in the exact same sights I had only hours earlier, warmed my heart. And, another thing: In that 4 minute journey into Manhattan, as we watched the cars and buildings sail passed us, the same excitement a small child feels on Christmas morning overtook me. I knew in that exact moment that I could love you. We were mere Subway Buddies then. In the time since, you've become my partner in crime. My rock/paper/scissors. I joke about the first time we met. . .. You rolled your eyes at my lame attempt at a joke (though I know you'll claim you never did such a thing!) and I thought to myself "there's no way this kid and I are going to get along!". Turns out, I couldn't have been more wrong. . . We ended up with a relationship far more dear to my heart than I'd ever imagined. The last thing I aim to do is scare you off with my overly flowery words. . . You know how us writers can be! I just wanted to let you know how very special you are to me, my dear. I've attached no ultimatums or pressure to this letter; only my most honest of thoughts and feelings. XOXOXO ‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãYours truly, ‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãMs. Evelyn Drinker

headline: So today... - w4m
body_text: Just now. Im here trying on shoes at the store. I walk over to the mirror, leaving my worn shoes over at the seat, along with my shopping cart with my personal belongings. As Im looking in the mirror, I see this elderly lady-morena kicks my sneakers over to plop right down on my spot. As she sits, she has her foot rest on my sneaker. Usually, I wouldnt say anything but take my things and move over to the next available seat. But I couldnt even do that, being that she so effortlessly had her foot resting on my freaking sneaker. OK. So I go over and tell her "Miss, you're sitting in my seat" She looks at me and goes off. I tell her, "Miss, you can have the seat, for thats not the issue here. The issue here is, I seen what you just did-you kicked my shoe and now youre..." The old lady, didnt even allow me to finish my sentence w/out her making me look like the worst kind of individual for arguing with an old lady over a seat. Thats the part, that igged me. Instead of just acknowledging/apologizing, no she'd rather argue, play the old lady card like a loud-speaker;despite my telling her directly the issue. Ofcourse I wouldve let it go from jump, but the fact she can muster all the energy in the world to not allow me a word in edgewise, to argue me down b/c gues what-I can speak English; was the reason I had to call her on it. When she seen I wouldnt let the issue go until she'd apologize, she got up but not without calling me all types of names under her breath, my favorite-"jackass".This is where I responded with "Yeah youre lucky, you're 100 yrs old..." Her grandson or son (?) jumps in and says "Or you do what?" Then we go at it. I point out, if the tables were turned and if I wouldve kicked her shoes to the side, to sit down I wouldve received the only curse-out; no questions asked. And yes, I did bring the race card. Threw in their face, that the reason that "they think they can get away with it with us, is b/c we're Hispanics". Then he pulls out "Do you have your diploma, you sound real uneducated"So wait a minute. I'm "uneducated" for pointing out the obvious. For finally speaking up for myself. Cause this type of treatment has been going on for the ages. We, always kept our mouths shut. Let it roll of our backs. Why? B/c at the end of the day, its not worth getting into it with 'savages'. So now, when someone defends themselves, we're labeled as "uneducated".OK.I have a friend/Spanish whose no more than five feet tall, if that!! Tell me why, she was constantly bullied in front of her kids then finally jumped so bad in front of her kids; that she suffers from health complications as a result. Had to move elsewhere. And guess who jumped her?I had another friend, that while she was walking with her nieces and nephews and her kids was jumped with all of them, at her side. She moved elsewhere. Same flipping problem. Being bullied relentlessly. Guess what she is? Guess who her bully is?My prior apartment dwelling. Bullied, taunted, humiliated on a constant for yrs by a grown woman with grandkids. Effing twice my age. Always showed her a's in front of my child, where I wouldnt budge cause as a mother, I'd rather look like the punk than for anything happen to us. Yet when it was only me and her and I approached her. Nothing. Not a peep. But as soon as I was with my child, she took advantage.And you threw how our worst fault is how we dont speak English. OK.Well maybe perhaps, some of us dont speak English. But what about the majority of those, who do match your skin color who speak the English very well. Well enough, to curse and call eachother "Nigger" and communicate via ebonics/street slang. Yeah those whose life purpose-despite growing up here, where we are rich in resources for getting ahead, college-wise and so forth-instead inspire to grow up to become high school drop outs, have kids out of wedlock from like ten different baby-daddys and run game on the welfare system? Yet theyre the same ones, screaming and hollering about police brutality. Theyre the same ones, cursing us out and quick to call us "illegals" The same ones, to pin us with African ancestry but in denial due to embarrassment-type-crap. The same ones, that are society throw-up; meaning drug dealing, keep the streets dirty and who dont know how to clean after themselves-no class, no education, nothing civilized about them whatsoever. And yeah-Im saying it.They're like, what is it that you called me many moons ago when you were out, smelling yourself...oh yeah "Gutter Trash".No more moreno-loving days for me. No mas. Im done. People arent born, hating. Its created. Now I understand many, many things thru the eyes of many, thru their description.And yeah, we may not speak English. The majority, they get married first, have kids working household and instill in their children to become productive model citizens in society. And if we do wrong, we're quick to point our faults. We dont sweep them under the rug and blame society for our hindrance. We do what we have to do. We're 'hungry' too. But we dont kill our own people via drug selling, leave our "baby-moms" to fend for themselves, nor treat any other races w/such effing disrespect. So you want to preach to me, police brutality...gee boy genius, is there any wonder the driving culprit? Here's a hint: Its not racism. And tho some police officers are rotten, but the other side of the story, carries responsibility as well.And then its not even you, not even you whose been writing me. Not even you. Oh and before I forget-you were quick to throw how my race is the worst, yet when we were dating-you never ceased to remind me how I was the very best you ever had. Now we're all the worst, all cause why....cause you married a morena. Really?! #FOHNever ceases to amaze me no matter how college/ivy-leagued educated an individual may have, they're like the worst in their ignorance. Youre preaching police brutality. Do you know just how simpleton of a joke, you sound. Like that vast amount of knowledge you racked up, and yet, still dont know how to use/think outside of the circle to think, for 'yourself'.Ninkumpoot.Not so long ago, I went to a job interview. Good job, w/the government too. The supervisor and I, hit it off immediately. I remember, leaving my jacket in a room where with whom I was introduced to, well I left my jacket there, while the supervisor gave a tour of the plant. Tell me why, when I was at the turnstyle with my jacket in tow, I had been left with empty pockets. Meaning-my metro card was stolen. Like really? Youre going to steal a lady's metro card??? And I know it wasnt stolen out of needs. It was straight malice. I declined the company's offer. Wasnt worth swimming in such sea of malice. Never bothered saying anything. But now, I'm going to email the supervisor to report 'em. B/c Im female and Hispanic. Youre going to dig into my pockets and have the nerve to steal a measling metro card, to screw my day over. Like thank goodness, I brought my purse with me.Le fuq am I doing, still on this site then. This craziness, you persist in having me entangled, does not pertain to me.Now more than ever, I know what I have to do.Its just the more I experience this crap, the more I see how flipping ruthless and disgusting your kind truly are. You all, would back stab me/our kind in a heartbeat. No regards no nothing. Savages.I swear to God Stan, Fuck you.I would say all of this directly, but alas due to limited open communication-yeah yeah we know. With that said, if you ever, ever once in your life ever EVER held an ounce of any "love" thats geniune, Im telling you, to please do not bother looking for me in the real world. Leave me be. I geniunely do not want anything to do with you. Ever. Dont bother looking for me. Nor bother to show face.To my sister-Word to the Wise-if you think they won't betray you, you are deadly mistaken. Other than that, when was the last time you spoke to Papi>? Lets pray, that you'd never ever end up on your death bed, puking up your lungs, liver bile; begging for air, but taking off that oxygen mask, so youd be able to die quicker b/c the pain of it all, is just too great. And just pray, that someone for whom you sacrificied so much for, never swears on your grave.Fuck you.

headline: What goes around comes around - w4mw
body_text: it's ironic, a complete stranger here questioned me as to whether I was going to be charitable because I have been in the past when in a similar situation, as if I owe him an explanation.the further irony is that people who are truly giving do not always have it come up. I would imagine that the person who presumes that the other is being less than giving simply because it wasn't mentioned is in fact the person who is less than giving and therefore doesn't perceive others as giving.if people faced their own issues which they know rather than psychoanalyzing strangers, we'd have better people and live in a better world. do what you can when you can and leave out the rest.it's for you to know and respectyour threshold. if someone has beenabusive, then leave him in the dust. you don't owe an explanation to anyone who's attempting to hurt you, distort the truth,and bring his own misery and drama to your life.if being a good person leaves you angry, then you have not respected your own genuine feelings. if you're expecting more from strangers than you expect from yourself then you should be questioning yourself.if you're contacting strangers in an attempt to understand his/hermotivations, that's energy best served on being the best person you can be, living the best life you can live, where you are proud of your character. if you're judging strangers you do not know, then you have not done sufficient work on yourself. you then must ask yourself why would you judge a stranger before passing judgmenton yourself, the only person you can truly know. no one is a perfect person. we can only do our bestbased upon the kind of life we wish to lead and embrace for ourselves. it's not one size fits all, so what works for youmay make no sense to someone else and vice versa.this is why the only person you should be rationallyjudging is yourself based upon the life you wish to lead.does the voice in your head encourage, support, and affirm you? or does it put you down and tell you what is not right with you? rid of that criticizing voice and bring peace to your mind.in order to truly live a healthy lifestyle it is important to have positive self talk. This means to speak to yourself in a loving way.a kind, happy, and peaceful mind is key.you are the source.it is what it is.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

headline: To the most beautiful woman with the beautifully flowered name - m4w

body_text: Seriously, how ignorant are you? You're going to email me about 'corrupt cops' against morenos and critique every other race but your own? Seriously??!?! But this is why, we have to stop bigging up these African American tv shows; showing them support and showering with media credit, when we post on social media. We so have to stop that altogether. Because 1- You never ever see not one African American bigging up any Hispanic in any way or form, in anything. 2- They're ALWAYS the first ones to bad-mouth our hispanic 'idol' celebrities, knock us to 'trump' over their matching skin celebrities. 3- We just need to start and stay representing our shows/etc; like we're never in the main stream in terms of tv shows/etc and why, b/c we hide behind these black shows giving them props on media outlet but wonder why, we can still count on one hand on how many Hispanic celebrities there are and why we are practically non-existent and why, society still refers to us as the cooty-illed illegals bringing this country down. When in reality, we are more than just "toilet-cleaners". And we are. Its just time, we owned our titulo. As for you, well thanks for allowing this vent. Thats one good thing that came out of this whole cl saga. That asswipe, you still have on your friendlist. That screams volumes. What he did. Lets put it this way, if the tables were turned I so wouldve deleted him off my fb-friendlist. Its not even about the romantic attachment between us. We couldve been purely platonic. But its just knowing your character, your struggles and the angle from where this asswipe was throwing his jabs ESPECIALLY knowing *his history* (like seriously, you gots nerve to talk??!)-I for one, would not had kept him on my friend list. You keeping him there, speaks volume. And I shouldnt have to tell you, or pitch a fit, that shouldve came from you. Not from me, telling you.Then again, what more can one expect who listened to a boricua, who told you I wasnt good for you. And you listened, no questions asked. Oh and your moms and sis. You mentioned how they were against us being serious back then, yet...yet-YET...I'm good enough now?! Gee. I wonder how that happened?!And see, unlike you and your people I do understand to a certain extent where your fam was coming from at that time. I do. Altho doesnt make it any right, nor pacifies the here-and-now tho.Its just YO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!All of this that we find ourselves in-You and I-when it comes down to us...couldve been so avoided if you'd just pulled up your man-pants and communicated with me in the real world. Instead, Im here alone on my end of my computer screen; venting what time left me with all due to your refusal to give me face. Now aint that a bitch!Its not even about the race thingy. Its about what I'd have to put up with, in the aftermath of all this. Red flags, never ceases to remind me that at the end of all this, I am only fooling myself when it comes to a happily ever after when it comes to us.Now that I myself, is coming out of that ignorance pool, I'm taking in how experience is the only motherfucker when it comes to teaching one, truth. To bypass what life's lessons in strength of 'love'...my gosh, what did I ever learn in the first place in doing so.You point out police brutality-me, for once I'd like to see for once, one black person doing the bitchin' point out what their race need to rectify in order to evolve as a whole. Yet as fast as they are at spitting on us, theyre the same ones to jab us with we're Africans then lynch us w/we're prejudice but in all, what they/and now you, fail to realize is, look at the source.Personally, its been day in and day out w/what Im fed about. I had an African American friend, who warned me about this eons ago, to which I really took as exaggeration. But now, nowhere nears of sorts. From my past relationship, I remember going thru it with my 'mother in law', who nitpicked my physique, who one day I so had to put her in her place by pointing out her daughter's well-rounded figure. Again, goes back to my rant earlier. Its like how much more can a person take with this crap. To only solidify this 'crap' indefinitely, by allowing your life to become mine?!!No. Can. Do.Let me clarify-theres bad apples in every race. Mine too. But its gotten to the point of no return-to say the least. Its like enough already.And if this is what I'm "experiencing" now-alone. And if your fam/friends are a certain way-alone. Taking into consideration, my other gripes, how you never listen. You never listen to me but to everyone else. What happens when we have problems in our relationship? You'll do, what you always do, run to one of your hen-friends who happens to be black who looks at me side-ways, for advice. Really? Leaving me, with no-sayso. As usual.Gotta ask myself. Do I really want to spend the rest of my 'pretty years' spent, w/a muzzle?! My so-called other half never takes into account, what I have to say, my wants and my needs cause Im not black enough or perhaps I dont know how it is to be black or simply Im not black, period. Thats just a gist. So you'll go to this hen friend, who happens to be black for advice b/c its how you roll. You go to everyone else, but the source, me.Why do I feel this...why? Cause its the only actions youve given me, time and time again. Back then, I was a spick. Not worthy of you, for such and such reasons and instead of listening to your heart, you listened. You listened to someone who had no geniune intentions towards you. Who succeeded in jypping you, out of me. Yeah-thats one. And for a great while thereafter-I remember, I wasnt good enough cause, well cause I was a 'spick'. You cock-blocked me at every turn whenever I attempted to win you back, cause well, I was a spick who wasnt good enough. Left me, for someone who matched your skin color. Still played that unfiltered fool for you, yet you still wouldnt budge, cause why???Yeah. I remember.And yet still, instead of just coming back to communicate directly like any sane person. You wouldnt speak to me in reality but stayed posting here. I said, I didnt want to do cl any more, you kept me here for ...whats that, think its going on to siete jodio anos.Whenever I called to get to the bottom of this, mayhem you hung up on me. Then laughed about it among your many posts here. You stalk me, when I went to the police I was the one arrested. You laughted about it. My mother died, yep you laughed about it and effed with my head ten times more. You told me, at my lowest to commit suicide. Then chase that comment with lovey dovey posts, filled with sentiments of sweet dreaming and far-fetched love.You laughed and made a mockery, at my pain. Aside from this mind-fucking cl world, you were trying to suck me in. In my world, where were you??? Where were you, when the stacks were down, where were you, when I needed you? Where were you, when the world was against me and I had to fend for myself...where were you??? Oh how I tended to forget-I'm a 'spick'. So you never bothered to look at me twice. Where were you? Oh busy sticking it in the morenas and white girls. Oh but I should feel special then, cause by the looks of it, I was the only Latina you ever looked at, huh?!!! As Im sure, if I never came to the picture, youd be married to a white girl. After going thru what Im going thru, cant say I blame you. Sad to say, but true.And even if,,,,even if the fairy tales youve written were ever true, I would always have to live my life second-guessing your actions. Who the eff, wants to live life like that???You never listen. You never take my words, with respect and value. And its not as if, Im swimming in success as Im sure theres always lessons to be learnt, such as life and still consider myself, a work in progress but if Im here, I arrived here on my own...alone.You never bothered to pick a phone. Not even snail-mailed me. You laughed and labeled me as delusional when I tried to contact you. Like what excuse in the world, do you have to rectify these actions?? I wasnt good enough for you then, so you know what, Im not good enough for you now either. You never even tried. Not one time. Not one. You listened to everyone else. You allowed everyone else decide the affairs to your heart.And tho despite me telling you directly, that the only thing you ever had to do was just come back. Fucking simple. Just come back home. You never did and you still wont. Something so simple. All I asked was for something tangible. Something real. And youve given, not one.So time is egging me w/"WTF are you still holding on to???"And I cant find not one reason to, not anymore.~Thank you for that.

Too much for her to handle. She was losing sight of her work, her friends, and her children. We were selfish. We were in love. A love that didn't have room for anything else but us. All consuming and devouring. Lust... Desire... Purest of pure. Like a drug we became addicted to each other. She couldn't let herself become dependent.She had to stop or lose everything. Like an addict she couldn't just have a little. And just like an addicts drug... I'm not apart of her life anymore. She longs for our love. It will always haunt her from every inch of her lovely body. Every pore... Every hair follicle... Every goosebump....Like shiver dots will be tipped in our ecstasy of passion. One day we will relapse. Dip ourselves in our drug. And reach the apex of ecstasy on each other. Blissfully stimulated from every atom in our body and every part of our heart and soul. Eternally yours, Pure LoveForever will you be my drug of choice.

headline: Almost a year - w4m
body_text: I've been through this over and over. I've played dozens of scenarios in my head over and over. If only I could turn back the clocks. I think of you often. 6 months and 22 days and thats all it took.6 months and 22 days for you to find a way into my heart and my life. 6 months and 22 days worth of hours long phone conversations,staying up to 6am. Talking about anything and everything. If only I could go back. I'd tell you I was wrong. If I could go back,I'd tell you I care. If I could go back,I'd tell you why I pushed you away. But I cant. And Im sitting here thinking about the past and Im left with "Ifs" and "What Ifs"I really did love you. I just couldnt say it. I was scared to reveal so much of myself. To you and to anyone.Which is probably why it hurt so much when you told me you had moved on and found another. "Almost over a year" You said. I get to thinking,We stopped talking less than a year ago. You moved on quick. And now I feel like nothing. Nothing was our time together. Nothing were the laughs we shared. Nothing were the secrets we exchanged. Nothing was the time you wrote me a song,confessing that you loved me for the first time. It all felt like nothing."Almost a year" "Almost a year". My world stopped when I heard those words,because unlike you I cant move on. I hate myself for pushing you away.I want you to be happy but I also wish It was with me. In my own selfish way,I dont want you to be happy with anyone. The pain of ending our relationship is still fresh. Almost a year later. I was never ready for the physical pain it would cause me. My chest gets tight when ever I think about you and everything we shared. Feels like I've been stabbed when ever I think of you with another girl. You were my first love and probably my only for years to come. I was younger then ,and I thought I knew it all. I've changed a lot,I've learned ,I've experienced the world more since we parted ways. And I KNOW I had a great man back then.I know you wont read this,and Thats okay. I just cant keep living with a heavy heart. I needed to get it out and in the open.

headline: Brunette in Central Park near 72nd Street - m4w
body_text: I was walking through Central Park this afternoon when I took a detour toward the west side. I was at the statue of the Falconer near the 72nd Street entrance when I sat down for a few minutes. I had on jeans and a dark green shirt, and I was carrying a brown leather jacket (it was warm today, even for this time of year.) I dropped my newspaper, the pages blew everywhere, and you ran over to help. You had dark brown, wavy hair, and a black coat. You were wearing a green skirt, or maybe a dress - your coat was buttoned, so I don't know which. In the moment, that's all I saw. I was too concerned, I suppose, with making sure I didn't lose my newspaper to the horses. It's not often that I spring for a copy of the New York Times. The breeze was strong, and the pages were blowing everywhere. But looking back on that brief interaction, there was more. I already had Real Estate and Dining & Wine tucked under my arm, and I didn't notice at the time how you laughed when we both reached for Weather; it was the same way you used to laugh on the playground. You could run faster than all of the boys - even me, and I used to tell everyone (like an idiot) that I could run faster than the wind itself. When you handed me the pages you'd picked up I didn't really pay any attention to your fingernails, but now that I think about it you used to bite them as a child, too. Nervous habit, I guess.I'll know you when I see you, I've always thought. I know I will. I have known it for twenty-seven years and that's how long I have been looking. It was the only thing I knew for certain other than the fact that I hadn't seen you yet, or if I had then I hadn't seen you fully.But really that's only a half-truth. I did see you once when we were younger. Well, technically I saw you almost every day, but there was one day in particular when I saw you: a single glance across a classroom, and you were looking back at me with eyes that were quicker than mine, smarter than mine. I knew you, then, but it was just a glimpse, and I thought I couldn't trust it. I didn't know I could trust it; we were only kids, after all. I looked away, and I've never been sorrier for any mistake I've made thus far in my life.Your eyes today - I don't know how I didn't recognize you in them.When you and I disappeared from each others' lives so many years ago, I didn't think of you at first. I'm sorry to say that most days I didn't think of you at all. Ashamed, if I'm being honest. But after a time - I can't say for sure how long - I started thinking of you most days. And then I started looking.I looked for you around corners. The corners of buildings, I mean, because I was still a boy too afraid that you would see me first. Now I'm older and smarter than I was, and I've learned to look for you around the corners of my mind while I walk north on MacDougal Street. I always throw quarters to the folk singers and shoot the shit with the old timers at the chess tables, and I always stop to talk with Dierdre who lives on Amsterdam Avenue but has sold hats on West 12th Street since 1974. (I wonder if Dierdre is her real name.) I never walk up Sixth Avenue because I prefer the closeness of Fifth and on the periphery of it all I always, I always, I always look for you.The ages have passed while I've walked these streets. I've seen thousands of faces, millions perhaps, but none of them were yours. I'll know you when I see you - I was sure of it. I convinced myself that I wouldn't even mind if you didn't know me right away. But I thought you would. I hoped.The park is for tourists, and families, and lovers, and secrets, and me.I don't always visit the Falconer. It was more of a coincidence that I turned in that direction at all. Most days I'll wait for you at Bethesda Fountain, but when I'm feeling masochistic I'll turn up at Rat Rock. When I can't take it anymore I'll stop looking altogether and walk through The Ramble until I get lost. (I can't get lost; I know those paths.) But it was the Falconer today, because during these autumn afternoons I like how the statue nearly escapes everyone's notice. I sat to his right, my jacket beneath me to dull the cold ground. I opened the newspaper I'd brought with me; since I hadn't seen you yet, I had to fill my time somehow.I'll never admit it, but I'm good at the crosswords.Sometimes I've wondered how often we've passed by each other looking in opposite directions; or stood on opposite ends of the same subway car; or sat at distant tables in the same bar, both of us drinking whatever's on tap; or; or; or. Sometimes I feared you didn't even live here anymore, that I'd wasted all these years for nothing. I looked into each face - I don't know you, I don't know you. I can't stay if you're not here, but I won't leave in case you are.I sat there on the grass, waiting, because that's mostly what I have done these many years - even while doing other things, really I'm always waiting to run into you again. At times I've wondered if there's something wrong with me, to spend half my life looking for someone who might be looking for someone else. Anyway, I must have been distracted by the leaves raining down, so when the wind picked up I lost my grip on the newspaper. The sections came apart mid-fall and landed scattered across the walking path below my overlook. Some people were startled - they really don't notice The Falconer up here, out of the way - and I jumped up to collect the pages before they blew into the street and I lost them to the horses and - oh, you know the rest.I saw you, but I didn't know you. I guess it's my fault; I wasn't paying attention. I guess you weren't either. So maybe we're both to blame. You know, sometimes I wonder if you're even looking. Hell, I'd stay in one place if I knew you were.

headline: sick day - w4w
body_text: My head feels empty. Maybe it's the chaga tea; maybe it's the head cold;maybe it's tennitus. There are parts I'm having a hard time letting go of.I don't feel like the fun, lighthearted friend anymoreand I haven't felt like explaining why to anyone outside the few closest to me.I don't think I was actually fun and lighthearted before,but I kept up a good show. I thought it my duty to entertain.That's not so much the case anymore. I've been isolating as a way to avoid explaining thatmy personality was a bit of a flukeand still isbecause there's not much to me right nowso I show what I knowbecause if I showed where I am,I wouldn't talk or smile or do anything at alland, well, I've got shit to doand tips to makeand friends to enjoy while I can,but alone- I feel quite empty.I don't feel like I'm falling apart andI don't feel that my self worth hangs on the approvalof those I respect or admire;I truly feel that the darkest hour has passed,but filling myself back up-that's another story.It's not something I can force.And as far as you-I try not to look forward to anythingand I try to remind myself that everything happensin its own timeand I try to remind myself that everything every single thingis an option. You hold my heart in your hands and the inconsistency of ourcommunication, reciprocation, everythinggives you the freedom to drop it and run over it.Those things can't be superglued.I trust that you'll be gentle with it. I can't imagine someone else would ever inspire me the way you do.As for me-well today I feel oddbut I've been saying that for years.

People have expectations of us that puts us in different places.I have this month and next month to get through, and then I can feel free to say 'fuck this shit, I'm going somewhere else now' and you have work as well, work and whatever else you can find to brighten your days. I have to admit that I miss loving my job the way you love yours, but then again, your job gives you so much and mine does nothing but drain my soul from me.I've started work on a new piece - it is emotionally draining - and have an idea kicking around for another one - which actually sounds like it is going to be fun (I heard the funniest story about a waiter - it needs to be written!) and I've heard that you honestly look like you are enjoying your latest conquest (and we both know it WILL be a conquest).Soon, I hope. Soon we will be able to sit down and talk, face to face. Then again, it is hope, and hope is truly a useless and dangerous emotion. I learned that a long time ago.So here is your ad, your wish for a kiss goodbye in the morning, and your desire for that normality that we both lack. Have a good day at work today, don't forget your lunch (brown paper bag, yummie!) and above all, love what you do, more than you love anything (or anyone) else. Be true to yourself, and remember, I will do everything I can to not lie to you - even when everyone else around me is lying to you.what news am I going to get from you today?Guess who?

headline: If you don't mind dating someone with a disability - m4w
body_text: So..I have a "disability" in the sense that I don't walk like everyone else. It's not grotesque or anything, but it looks like I have a limp. When I was in high school, the jock honestly asked me if I was high. No, it's just the way I walk. Other than that, I'm attractive, athletic, funnier than the funniest person you know so far, a childlike sense of imagination, love to travel, have a great career going and am pretty well settled in life. I'm 32 years old and the only thing I'm missing is someone to share it with. Maybe I'll find that person here?I tend to be attracted to someone who has the same sort of personality and who is pretty laid back.It's tough to date with this disability though, I feel like that's an automatic dealbreaker for most people. Also, please no replies with words of encouragement- I mean, I'll get your email, and I'll be like "Yesssh!" and then I open it, and it turns out to be a message like from Hallmark, ya know? Let's go on a date and autumn in love!

When he met a girl, the first question he asked himself wasn't whether she was good for a few dates; it was whether she was the kind of girl he could imagine spending time with in the long haul...........................................................................Nicholas Sparks, The Last Song

It's a miracle I am alive. I try to be kind to people because God saved my life on several occasions. I'm really confused about life and the unfairness of the world really confuses me beyond anything reasonable. I tried being gay but I don't know I still lay in bed day dreaming about sexy underwear and panty hose with a really short skirt. I guess I just miss bow some past gf would baby me when I don't feel good. You can hear the fluid shifting around in my intestinal tract which means I gotta go. Real shitty night

headline: Green hoodie -Crossing Meeker under the BQE - m4m
body_text: You and I crossed paths around 10pm on Tuesday night. You were wearing a green hoodie and black athletic pants and seemed to be on the phone. When first we crossed, we both checked one another out and then realized we were following the same path on opposite sides of the street. There was another mutual glance at the traffic light, then a pass under the BQE, another glance, and then one final before we turned opposite directions. You were on the phone, or I would have called to you to introduce myself. Perhaps you'll see this, or maybe you live around that initial intersection and we'll see one another again. If you DO see this, write me what I was wearing/what I look like/or what I was carrying. I'd love to take you on a date.

headline: Downtown 6 train from 77th to 42nd - w4m

You turned around to look at me and I smiled and you waved. I tried to ask you what stop you were getting off at but you couldn't tell what I was saying so I held up my fingers to says I was getting off at 23rd and you said you were going farther and waved goodbye as your express train came. I wish I had gotten off at 42nd as well and asked you your name...

headline: Maria from the Bronx - m4w
body_text: In the spring of 2010 we met online and fell in love.I was an office drone in Birmingham, Alabama working six day weeks with no goals more long term than returning to my hometown of Atlanta, Georgia and finding a better life. You told me you were a born and raised New Yorker of Mexican/Honduran descent, newly wed, living and working in Manhattan. Something drew me to direct message you though we had never met. You said your name was Maria. You would later tell me that you had never had any desire to converse with someone you didn't know, but that I had been just charismatic enough (you'd insert a winking emoticon here), to piqued your interest. We spoke late into that night, the following night, and the night after that.We quickly grew close. Every additional conversation was a new discovery in how amazingly well we meshed together. We both had never meet another person that we instantly felt like we had known forever. You loved Aaliyah, the Yankees, and chamomile tea. You loved reading and told me you would be surrounded with Orchids at all times if it were possible. You teased me about being a silly country boy who was much too proud of the bad Spanish he picked up during Peace Corps service and found my love of 90's New York hip hop amusing for someone that had grown up on a road named after a part of a farm animal's anatomy. I teased you about your obsession with the discontinued Johnson's Body Care - Melt Away Stress Lavender & Chamomile Body Wash and the tattoo you got on your right hip at twenty that read "fire and ice" in Chinese characters. When you revealed to me shortly thereafter you several months pregnant, I felt like I somehow already knew.You had gotten married to your on again/off again boyfriend you had known for several years. You had found out he was cheating, separated, gotten back together, discovered you were pregnant, and agreed to marry. You had hope it would led to better things. It had not. You said he showed less interest in being a husband or a father seemingly by the day. I learned most nights would find you sleeping on small couch after some fight or argument as he slumbered in the apartment's queen-size bed. You had decided shortly before we met you would move out as soon after you had the baby. You had miscarried before and were scared. Your mother, who I would come to learn had been your absolute everything, had passed recently and unexpectedly from a stroke at 52. It was very hard for you to speak about your father.We had agreed early on to keep our correspondence quiet. You were worried it it might negatively affect any divorce settlement agreement and needed every penny possible to move out. You wanted to take these next steps on your own with no help from anyone. Whenever I attempted to offer any money or assistance, you would tell me you only need my time, love, and patience. I named the little girl in your growing belly "Melon," because you constantly craved melon as she grew bigger and bigger. You jokingly insisted her middle name was going to be Melon until I wasn't sure if you were joking anymore. You were excited to be a mother. You begin talking about finding a job in Atlanta and bringing yourself and little Melon down south to start over. We'd giggle over the idea of orchid-filled weddings and that beautiful shiny antique vintage wedding ring you had saw an elderly woman wearing on the L one day. I had never felt more excited or hopeful about the future. We were in love.Melon came too early and didn't survive. You moved in with your older sister in the Bronx. We mourned together. You struggled. I fought with you to see a professional to help you work through things. You had gone earlier in life and disliked the process immensely. I worried about more and more about you, both with issues I have mentioned here and others I have not. The dark days became increasingly frequent and were beginning to be the norm and not the exception. In your most soberest moment, you revealed you wish you could go to sleep and not wake up. This terrified me. I felt you slipping away.The last I heard from you was September 22nd (or possibly the 25th) of 2013. You sent me and email reading: "Sorry.¬†I'll talk to you soon. I'm alright."¬†Days turned into weeks and I began to worry. Weeks turned months and I feared the worst. I continue to do everything I can to find you. Last year through a miracle I still don't quite understand, I was able to somehow locate your sister's apartment in the Bronx. Within a few days, I had flown to the New York for the first time and found myself on the stoop in front of your sister's building on Rochambeau Avenue in the Bronx. Several people in the building including your neighbors recognized you, but didn't know you or your sister beyond an occasional hello. The apartment had been vacated some months before. The building management had no additional info. I spent the next several days in New York tracking down any and every lead I could, but ultimately came up with only dead ends.Maria, I hope you're out there. I hope you're reading this. If not, I hope to hear from someone that knows you. If Maria's sister is reading this: Im sorry we never didnt know each other. Your sister and I loved each other very much. Please understand that anything is preferable to the pain of not knowing what happened to someone you cared about so deeply. Maria is 5'4" or 5'5". She worked book keeping/Administration in Manhattan. She has naturally curly hair she usually wears straight. She has been to the emergency rooms several times for Asthma and uses a Nebulizer. She has a bad back from falling off a swing as a child. Her older sister is her only other sibling. Her sister may have married a man with the last name "Herreras" or "Herrera," or possible "Simon Herrera(s)," or "Simon B Herrera(s)." Maria has a very close friend in Connecticut that she visited regularly. The friend was married, has three boys, and may have been expecting a fourth at some point. Maria said when they were together, people thought they were sisters and was always excited to spend time with her. One of my favorite emails from you reads: "Woke up feeling, happy. In love. Wish I could click my heels and make everything be a I want it. But...with some work...a lil time...getting to that place. Everything as I want it to be. Never would've thought...that I'd find you. That you would've been "Mr. Right" for me. Never felt this way before. And now...want to feel like this always."If I have lost you, I'd like to come back to New York and say goodbye to you. I promise to prettiest Orchids I can find with you. They were always your favorite.

body_text: today...if we're on the same page bud, what time was the event? you're very nice...and hot!!

headline: Hey James Bond, Snapchat Girl here... - w4m
body_text: Dear Supremely Attractive Man Dressed As James Bond,It was Saturday night, the height of Halloween celebrations. I was the girl dressed as a Snapchat filter. I had super rouged cheeks, a rainbow painted on my chin, was wearing a black leather dress/jacket/booties, and was constantly unhinging my jaw to imitate a video filter. You were tall, dark, and handsome, wearing a suit or tuxedo that led me to believe that you were dressed as a dapper British spy for the evening. I think our alter-egos speak volumes. James Bond is definitely a Snapchat kinda guy. I appreciate a man who's packing heat.Allow me to explain: after Friday night's All Hallow's Eve shenanigans, I was exhausted and incapable of putting on pants, getting off of the couch, and concocting one of the many excellent ideas I had for another costume (Tinderella? Chris Christie? Captain Underpants?). After rummaging through my closet and almost pulling a Lizzie McGuire-esque outfit repeat, I turned to my most beloved and frequently used app, Snapchat; it's an app for which I am known for notoriously over-abusing - a notion that I personally deem impossible. I did not have a costume, but I did have a crate of crafting supplies from my sorority girl days... and so I showered, put on a short leather dress, blowdried my hair, and painted my chin into a stream of rainbow vomit, complete with sparkles. And yes, I used straight-up acrylic paint. On my face.I'm going to blame the paint that I accidentally ingested that night for what occurred between us. As my friends and I moved from our pre-game on 2nd Ave to our first destination of the night on Ave B, somewhere along East 4th Street, you and your friends walked towards us. My Evolution of Taylor Swift squad followed me, and your group laughed as they recognized my efforts. "Hey, she's Snapchat! That's so funny!" Then you, objectively one of the most attractive men in New York, took the time to physically stop me on the street and compliment my costume as a conversation starter."Hey, I really like this! Great idea!" you said, touching my arm.My response?In a split second, I widened my eyes and opened my mouth in a crude imitation of the actual filter, and the most questionable noise erupted from my windpipe. I "meeeeeehr"ed at you and proceeded to walk away quickly in shock while my girl gang followed with peals of laughter. And for that, I am so sorry. This is why I am decidedly single. I wasn't even drunk yet.I regretted making that face/sound/life decision immediately afterwards and for the remainder of the night.
